humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 2.2 cm, which falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The tumor is classified as a poorly differentiated invasive ductal carcinoma, and the T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. The presence of focal in situ spread and neuroendocrine characteristics does not affect the T stage. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathologic T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor diameter is specified as 2.2 cm. According to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system for breast cancer, a T2 designation is given to tumors that measure between 2.0 cm and 5.0 cm in size. Therefore, based on the information provided in this report, the patient's cancer has a pathologic T stage of T2.
